et: Middle English {it}frontel{/it}, from Medieval Latin {it}frontellum{/it}, diminutive of Latin {it}front-, frons{/it}
dt: {bc}a cloth hanging over the {a_link|front} of an altar

shortdef: a cloth hanging over the front of an altar

dt: {bc}of, relating to, or adjacent to the forehead or the frontal bone
{bc}of, relating to, or situated at the {a_link|front}
{bc}directed against the front or at the main point or issue {bc}{sx|direct||}
{bc}parallel to the main axis of the body and at right angles to the sagittal plane
{bc}of or relating to a meteorological front

shortdef: of, relating to, or adjacent to the forehead or the frontal bone
of, relating to, or situated at the front
directed against the front or at the main point or issue : direct

dt: {bc}a bone that forms the forehead and roofs over most of the orbits and nasal cavity and that at birth consists of two halves separated by a suture

shortdef: a bone that forms the forehead and roofs over most of the orbits and nasal cavity and that at birth consists of two halves separated by a suture

dt: {bc}the anterior division of each cerebral hemisphere

shortdef: the anterior division of each cerebral hemisphere
